- Reason for refund (from dropdown: "Damaged items", "Incorrect item", "Item not as described", "Didn't receive", "Changed mind")
- Order of items to refund (checkboxes, each with SKU and quantity — defaults to whole order)
- Upload option for photos (optional if reason is "Damaged items" or "Incorrect item")
- Delivery confirmation code (if "Didn’t receive" is selected)

IF the refund request is for less than the full order, THEN THE system SHALL:

- Calculate refund amount based on item price and tax
- Deduct original shipping cost if item shipped was part of free shipping promotion
- Apply restocking fee if requested by seller (if configured by admin, max 15% per item)
- Show preview of refund amount (item subtotal, shipping adjustments, fees) before submission

WHEN the refund request is submitted, THE system SHALL:

- Set order status to "Refund Requested"
- Notify seller via dashboard alert
- Place a 72-hour timer for seller response

IF the seller approves the refund:

- SET status to "Refund Approved"
- Notify admin on refund amount
- Initiate refund payment through original gateway
- SET status to "Refunded"
- Update inventory (if returning physical items, inventory remains decremented until returned)
- Send confirmation to customer

IF the seller denies the refund:

- SET status to "Refund Denied"
- Notify customer with reason given by seller
- Allow customer to escalate request to admin

IF the seller does not respond within 72 hours:

- AUTO-APPROVE refund for full amount
- SET status to "Refunded"
- Send notification to customer
- Notify admin of auto-approval

WHEN an admin overrides a seller’s decision (to approve or deny):

- Admin SHALL be able to override at any point after request submitted
- Changes SHALL be logged with admin ID and reason
- System SHALL auto-update status and trigger refund if approved

THEN THE system SHALL record all refund actions, communication, and final payment state in the order audit log with associated timestamps.

### Product Return Policy

THE system SHALL allow customer returns only for items with status "Delivered" or "Refunded".

WHEN a refund is approved and return is required, THE system SHALL:

- Generate a prepaid return shipping label (based on carrier, region, and product weight — determined by seller’s configured return policy)
- Email the label to the customer
- Display the label in the order's "Returns" section
- Provide a 14-day window from time of approval to return item

IF the customer does not initiate return within 14 days:

- THE system SHALL auto-cancel the return request
- THE order SHALL revert to "Completed" status
- NO inventory shall be restored
- NO further refund shall be issued

IF the customer sends the item back:

- Seller SHALL receive notification with return tracking number
- Seller SHALL have 10 business days to inspect the returned item
- Seller SHALL mark return as either "Received & Approved" or "Received & Rejected"

IF seller rejects return:

- THE system SHALL notify customer with reason provided by seller
- THE system SHALL reverse the refund if already paid
- THE order SHALL be set to "Refund Reversed"
- the returned item DOES NOT return to inventory

IF seller approves return:

- THE system SHALL restore inventory of returned SKUs to seller’s available stock
- THE system SHALL confirm: "Your return has been processed. The refund of [amount] has been fully credited."
- THE order SHALL be set to "Refunded & Returned"

WHERE the seller has configured a "no returns" policy on a specific SKU (admin must approve flag):

- THE system SHALL block return request for that item
- WHEN customer attempts to return, THE system SHALL display: "This item is final sale and cannot be returned. Contact seller for assistance."

The return labeling system SHALL be responsible only for generation and display:

- The responsibility of ensuring the package is sent, tracking number is entered, and item is received lies entirely with the customer
- The system SHALL NOT verify physical receipt — only that the return label was generated and claimed

All return activities SHALL be logged in audit trail:

- Return request timestamp
- Return label generation timestamp
- Return shipping scan (customer-provided or carrier-provided)
- Seller inspection and decision
- Inventory restoration or rejection event
- Final refund reversal or confirmation

Any return activity not logged shall be considered invalid.

## Business Rule Summary

- Admin ALWAYS has final authority over cancellations and refunds — overrides seller decisions
- Seller CAN update shipping details and approve/deny refund requests but cannot change order status directly past "Shipped"
- Customer may request cancellation only up to "Awaiting Shipment" with conditions
- Customer may request refund only after "Delivered"
- Refund requires three-party alignment: customer request → seller approval → system processing
- Inventory is only restored upon physical return and seller acceptance
- Every action is immutable and permanently logged in audit trail
- No custom statuses or manual status skips allowed

The system SHALL prevent any status transitions that violate this lifecycle. Any attempt to manually set an invalid status shall be blocked and logged as a security violation.

files.reason: To define the processes by which users and sellers interact after purchase — reviews, ratings, and seller responsiveness. This drives community and reputation.
keyQuestions: Can a buyer review a product without purchasing it?
How long after purchase can reviews be submitted?
Can sellers delete negative reviews?
How are fake or abusive reviews handled?
constraints: Must require verified purchase to submit review
Must allow sellers to publicly respond to reviews
Must enable reporting of inappropriate reviews
Must display verified purchase badge
files.content:
# Product Reviews and Ratings

### Review Submission Rules

WHEN a customer completes an order, THE system SHALL enable the customer to submit a review for any product included in that order.

WHILE a product has been marked as delivered in the order tracking system, THE system SHALL allow review submission.

IF a review is submitted more than 90 days after the order delivery date, THEN THE system SHALL reject the submission with an error message stating "Too late to review - reviews must be submitted within 90 days of delivery."

IF a customer attempts to submit a review for a product they did not purchase, THEN THE system SHALL block the submission and display "You must purchase this item before reviewing it."

THE system SHALL prevent multiple reviews for the same product by the same customer.

WHERE a customer has previously submitted a review for a product, THE system SHALL allow the customer to edit their review before 14 days have passed since the review was published.

THE customer SHALL be allowed to submit one rating and one written review per product.

### Rating Scale and Display

THE system SHALL use a 5-star rating scale for product reviews, with whole-number values only (1, 2, 3, 4, 5).

WHEN a product page is loaded, THE system SHALL display the average customer rating rounded to one decimal place.

THE system SHALL show the total number of reviews for each product.

WHEN displaying individual reviews, THE system SHALL show each rating as five filled or empty star icons, with no half stars.

WHEN viewing a product catalog listing, THE system SHALL show a small star icon with rating number beside the product title if the product has 2 or more reviews.

### Moderation and Reporting

IF a review contains profanity, hate speech, threats, personal information, or spam, THEN THE system SHALL automatically flag it for moderation.

WHEN a review is flagged for moderation, THE system SHALL hide it from public view and notify admin.

WHEN a user reports a review, THE system SHALL log the report with reporter ID, reason selection, and timestamp, and notify admin.

WHERE a reported review has more than three reports, THE system SHALL automatically trigger a queue for admin review.

THE admin SHALL be able to reject and delete any review regardless of moderation flags.

THE system SHALL maintain an audit log of all reviews deleted by admin, including user ID, review ID, deletion timestamp, and reason.

### Seller Response Mechanism

WHEN a customer submits a review, THE system SHALL notify the seller of the associated product.

WHEN a seller logs in, THE system SHALL display a notification badge indicating if they have unread customer reviews.

THE seller SHALL be able to write a public response to any customer review, up to 500 characters.

WHEN a seller responds to a review, THE system SHALL display both the customer review and the seller response together on the product page.

THE seller response SHALL be clearly labeled "Seller Response" and shown below the customer review.

WHEN a seller edits their response, THE system SHALL update the response and record the edit timestamp.

WHEN a review is marked as fraudulent or removed by admin, THE system SHALL automatically remove the associated seller response.

### Review Eligibility Criteria

EVERY review submission SHALL require a verified purchase.

THE system SHALL verify purchase eligibility by matching the reviewing customer ID with the buyer ID from the order records.

THE system SHALL NOT accept reviews for products purchased through external channels or as gifts.

WHERE a customer purchases multiple units of the same product in one order, THE system SHALL allow one review per customer, not per unit.

### Review Verification

WHEN a review is published, THE system SHALL display a "Verified Purchase" badge to the left of the review title.

THE "Verified Purchase" badge SHALL only appear if the customer’s ID matches the buyer ID in a completed, non-canceled order for that exact product SKU.

WHERE a customer has purchased the product but the order was later canceled or refunded in full, THE system SHALL remove the "Verified Purchase" badge from their review.

IF the order payment failed and was never completed, THEN THE system SHALL prevent review submission entirely.

THE system SHALL NOT permit reviews from guest users unless they have created an account before attempting to submit a review.

WHEN a review is submitted under a guest account that is later registered to a customer account, THE system SHALL link the review to the new account and retain the "Verified Purchase" badge if eligibility criteria are met.

files.reason: To map the seller’s internal workflow — how they create products, manage inventory, fulfill orders, and view analytics. This ensures seller platform usability.
keyQuestions: How does a seller become approved?
How are new SKUs created and linked to products?
What data is visible on seller analytics?
How often are payouts processed?
constraints: Must require admin approval before seller can list products
Must allow seller to set individual inventory per SKU
Must show order volume and revenue per product
Must define payout frequency (e.g., weekly)
files.content:
# Seller Dashboard Workflow

### Seller Onboarding and Approval

WHEN a new user selects the "Become a Seller" option during registration, THE system SHALL mark the user account as "seller-prospect".

WHEN a seller-prospect submits their business details (legal business name, tax identification number, bank account information), THE system SHALL notify an admin via the Admin Dashboard.

WHEN an admin reviews and approves a seller application, THE system SHALL change the user role from "seller-prospect" to "seller" and unlock the ability to create product listings.

WHEN an admin rejects a seller application, THE system SHALL send an email notification to the user with a reason for rejection and allow re-submission after 7 days.

WHILE a seller is in "seller-prospect" status, THE system SHALL prohibit access to the Seller Dashboard and all product management features.

IF a seller-prospect does not complete business documentation within 30 days, THE system SHALL automatically deactivate the prospect status and request re-application.

### Product Creation Flow

WHEN a seller accesses the Seller Dashboard, THE system SHALL display a "Add New Product" button.

WHEN a seller clicks "Add New Product", THE system SHALL open a multi-step form requiring:

- Product name (up to 200 characters, non-empty)
- Product description (minimum 50 characters)
- Category selection from system taxonomy (root category and one subcategory)
- Base price (minimum $0.01, maximum $10,000, exactly two decimal places)
- Product images (at least one, maximum 10 images, each under 5MB, JPG or PNG)
- Return policy (selection from: "No Returns", "30-Day Returns", "90-Day Returns")

WHEN a seller submits the product creation form, THE system SHALL create a master product record with status "pending-sku-setup".

WHERE product has variants (e.g., color, size), THE system SHALL require the seller to define at least one SKU combination before approval.

WHEN a seller adds an initial SKU variant (e.g., "Red, Large"), THE system SHALL enable inventory setting for that specific combination.

WHEN a seller saves any SKU variation, THE system SHALL not make the product publicly visible until at least one SKU is defined and inventory is set above zero.

WHEN a seller duplicates an existing product, THE system SHALL create a new master product with all fields copied but with "Draft" status and zero inventory for all SKUs.

### SKU Inventory Management

WHEN a seller defines a product variant, THE system SHALL treat it as a unique SKU with separate inventory tracking.

WHEN a seller sets inventory for a specific SKU (e.g., "Blue, Small"), THE system SHALL store the quantity as an integer ≥ 0.

WHEN a seller reduces inventory to zero for all SKUs of a product, THE system SHALL automatically change the product's public status to "out-of-stock" but keep the listing visible.

WHILE a product is "out-of-stock", THE system SHALL prevent customers from purchasing any of its SKUs but allow wishlist addition.

WHEN a seller increases inventory for a previously out-of-stock SKU, THE system SHALL automatically change the product's public status to "in-stock".

WHERE the seller has multiple warehouses, THE system SHALL allow inventory to be split across locations, but aggregate visibility to customers must show total available quantity.

WHEN a seller updates SKU inventory, THE system SHALL log the change with timestamp, who made it, and old vs new quantity.

IF a seller attempts to set negative inventory for a SKU, THE system SHALL reject the update with error message: "Inventory cannot be negative."

IF a seller attempts to delete a SKU that has associated order items, THE system SHALL prevent deletion and display: "This SKU cannot be deleted because it has been ordered. Reduce inventory to zero instead."

### Order Fulfillment Process

WHEN a new order is placed containing items from a seller's products, THE system SHALL create a separate fulfillment task for that seller in their Dashboard.

WHEN a seller views their order list, THE system SHALL display:

- Order number
- Buyer name and contact info (email and shipping address)
- List of SKUs purchased with quantities
- Order total and payment status
- Date/time of purchase
- Order status ("pending-fulfillment", "shipping-in-progress", "completed", "cancelled" by customer)

WHEN a seller selects "Ship Order", THE system SHALL require them to:

- Select shipping method from list: "Standard", "Expedited", "Overnight"
- Enter valid tracking number (alphanumeric, 10-30 characters)
- Confirm the items have been packed and handed to carrier

WHEN a seller submits shipping details, THE system SHALL:

- Change order status to "shipping-in-progress"
- Send buyer notification with tracking information
- Display tracking number on order details page visible to buyer

WHILE an order status is "pending-fulfillment", THE system SHALL allow seller to cancel the order only if the buyer has not paid.

IF a buyer requests cancellation of their order, THE system SHALL notify the seller immediately through dashboard alert.

WHEN a seller cancels an order due to stock shortage, THE system SHALL:

- Change order status to "canceled-by-seller"
- Initiate refund process for the buyer
- Notify the buyer: "We're sorry, this item is out of stock. Your payment will be refunded."

IF a seller fails to fulfill an order within 48 hours of purchase, THE system SHALL automatically escalate the order to admin for intervention.

### Sales and Analytics Dashboard

WHEN a seller logs into their dashboard, THE system SHALL display a summary panel with:

- Total products listed
- Total active SKUs
- Total sales in last 30 days
- Total revenue in last 30 days
- Pending orders to fulfill

WHERE seller has ten or more products, THE system SHALL display a graph showing sales trends over the last 7, 30, and 90 days.

WHEN a seller clicks "View Product Performance", THE system SHALL display a table with:

- Product name
- SKU variants
- Units sold
- Revenue generated per SKU
- Average rating
- Number of reviews
- Inventory level per SKU
- Change in sales from previous period

WHEN a seller selects "Export Reports", THE system SHALL allow export of sales data as CSV with columns: date, product name, SKU variant, units sold, revenue, order id.

### Earnings and Payout Schedule

WHILE a seller has accrued earnings, THE system SHALL accrue payments on a weekly cycle.

THE system SHALL calculate seller earnings as: 

- 100% of product sale price minus payment processing fees (3.5% per transaction)
- Payment processing fees = payment_gateway_fee * transaction_amount

WHEN a payment cycle ends (each Monday at 00:00 Korea time), THE system SHALL:

- Consolidate all earnings from the previous week
- Subtract any platform fee (15% of net revenue)
- Calculate net payout amount
- Generate payout record

WHEN a payout is processed, THE system SHALL:

- Transfer funds to the seller's linked bank account
- Send email notification: "Your weekly payout of $X.XX has been processed."
- Update ledger in Seller Dashboard with date, amount, and payout ID

WHERE seller's net earnings for a week are less than $20, THE system SHALL roll over the balance to the next week until cumulative total reaches $20.

WHEN a seller changes their bank account information, THE system SHALL require confirmation via email and suspend all payouts for 24 hours as a security measure.

IF a seller has an open dispute or pending refund, THE system SHALL freezing payout equivalent to the disputed amount until resolved.

WHERE a seller has been suspended or banned, THE system SHALL forfeit all pending earnings and notify the seller: "Your account has been suspended. All pending payouts have been forfeited."


> *Developer Note: This document defines **business requirements only**. All technical implementations (architecture, APIs, database design, etc.) are at the discretion of the development team.

files.reason: To define the administrative functions for overseeing the entire platform — including user, product, and order management. This ensures system integrity and governance.
keyQuestions: What actions can admins take on any user?
How are fraudulent sellers identified and handled?
Can admins edit product listings directly?
What reports must be exportable?
constraints: Must allow admin to suspend or ban any user without seller confirmation
Must allow admin to override seller fulfillment decisions
Must enable export of financial and user activity reports
Must maintain audit log of all admin actions
files.content:
## Admin Dashboard Requirements

The admin dashboard serves as the central governance interface for overseeing the entire shopping mall platform. Administrators have full authority to manage users, products, orders, and system integrity. This document defines the operational workflows, permissions, and constraints for administrative functions.

### User Management

Admins have unrestricted control over all user accounts regardless of role (customer, seller, or admin). The system SHALL support the following user management capabilities:

- WHEN an admin selects a user account, THE system SHALL display full user profile data, including registration date, email, phone, shipping addresses, last login, and active sessions.
- WHEN an admin initiates a suspension, THE system SHALL immediately revoke all active sessions and prevent further login attempts.
- WHEN an admin initiates a permanent ban, THE system SHALL permanently disable the account, retain all associated data for audit purposes, and prevent future registration using the same email or phone number.
- WHILE a user account is suspended, THE system SHALL NOT allow any actions requiring authentication (e.g., placing orders, leaving reviews, accessing cart or wishlist).
- WHILE a user account is banned, THE system SHALL NOT allow any interaction with the platform, including viewing public product listings.
- IF an admin attempts to ban or suspend their own account, THE system SHALL display an error message and prevent the action.
- IF an admin attempts to delete a user account, THE system SHALL NOT permit deletion; instead, THE system SHALL only allow suspension or banning to preserve audit trails.
- WHERE an admin selects multiple users, THE system SHALL enable bulk suspension or banning operations with confirmation step.
- WHERE a user has an active order in progress, THE system SHALL display a warning before suspending or banning that user.
- THE system SHALL maintain an immutable audit log of all admin actions performed on user accounts, including timestamp, admin ID, action type, and reason provided.

### Seller Approval Panel

Sellers are provisioned accounts that require explicit administrative approval before they can list products or receive orders.

- WHEN a new seller registers, THE system SHALL create an account in "Pending Approval" status.
- WHEN an admin accesses the seller approval panel, THE system SHALL display a list of pending sellers with their business name, contact information, documents uploaded (e.g., ID, business license), and registration date.
- WHEN an admin approves a seller, THE system SHALL change their status to "Approved", send a notification email, and grant access to seller dashboard features.
- WHEN an admin rejects a seller, THE system SHALL change their status to "Rejected", send a notification with reason, and prevent reapplication for 30 days.
- IF a seller submits multiple approval requests within 30 days of rejection, THE system SHALL block further attempts and notify the admin via email.
- WHILE a seller is pending approval, THE system SHALL NOT allow them to list products, update inventory, or view sales analytics.
- WHERE a seller's submitted documents appear fraudulent or inconsistent, THE system SHALL highlight flags for admin review (e.g., mismatched names, invalid document numbers, stock photo indicators).
- THE system SHALL support one-click re-approval for sellers previously approved and deactivated.
- THE system SHALL maintain a history of all seller approval actions, including approver, decision time, and rationale.

### Product Moderation

Admins regulate product listings to ensure compliance with platform standards and legal requirements.

- WHEN an admin opens the product moderation panel, THE system SHALL display all products with moderation status (Pending, Approved, Rejected, Flagged).
- WHEN an admin flags a product, THE system SHALL immediately remove it from public search and catalog results, notify the seller, and trigger a review queue.
- WHEN an admin approves a flagged product, THE system SHALL restore its visibility to customers.
- WHEN an admin rejects a product, THE system SHALL remove it from the catalog, notify the seller with specific violation reason (e.g., "infringes copyright", "misleading description", "prohibited item"), and log the action.
- IF a product is flagged by multiple customers and confirmed as invalid, THE system SHALL automatically escalate to admin review.
- IF a seller has three or more rejected products in a 30-day period, THE system SHALL trigger a seller audit flag for admin review.
- WHERE a product contains regulated content (e.g., pharmaceuticals, weapons, adult material), THE system SHALL require explicit admin approval before publication.
- WHERE a product listing violates local legal restrictions in the user's region, THE system SHALL hide it from users in that region and notify the seller.
- THE system SHALL maintain a log of all moderation actions, including product ID, seller ID, admin ID, timestamp, action taken, and reason provided.
- THE system SHALL allow admin to edit product titles, descriptions, categories, and images directly without requiring seller intervention, with all changes recorded in an audit trail.

### Order Override and Investigation

Admins may override seller-initiated order decisions to protect platform integrity and customer experience.

- WHEN an admin accesses an order under investigation, THE system SHALL display full order history, payment details, seller communication logs, shipping updates, and customer service interactions.
- WHEN an admin overrides a seller's order fulfillment decision, THE system SHALL immediately notify the seller that fulfillment has been overridden and auto-assign fulfillment to a backup vendor if available, or initiate admin-managed fulfillment.
- WHEN an admin cancels an order after payment processing, THE system SHALL refund the customer automatically and update the payment gateway.
- WHEN an admin deactivates a seller's order processing privileges, THE system SHALL place all pending orders from that seller into "Admin Hold" status and notify the customer.
- WHILE an order is under admin investigation, THE system SHALL prevent the seller from shipping or updating the order status.
- WHILE an order is in "Admin Hold" status, THE system SHALL display a visual badge on the order in customer and seller dashboards.
- IF an order volume from a single seller exceeds 80% of the overall daily order count, THE system SHALL trigger an automated alert for admin review.
- IF an admin detects patterns of fraudulent order creation (e.g., high-value orders with common shipping addresses), THE system SHALL flag the associated accounts for investigation.
- THE system SHALL log all override actions, including original seller decision, admin override, timestamp, reason, and whether refund was issued.

### Refund Approval Authority

Admins have final authority over refund decisions when seller and customer disagreement persists.

- WHEN a customer requests a refund, THE system SHALL notify the seller and wait for response within 48 hours.
- IF the seller denies the refund within 48 hours, THE system SHALL escalate the request to admin review.
- WHEN an admin reviews a refund request, THE system SHALL display order details, reason given by customer, seller’s justification, delivery confirmation, product condition report, and communication history.
- WHEN an admin approves a refund, THE system SHALL initiate full or partial refund to the original payment method and notify both parties.
- WHEN an admin denies a refund request, THE system SHALL notify the customer with reason and indicate if appeal is possible.
- WHERE a product has been returned, THE system SHALL require physical return confirmation from the shipping carrier before processing refund, unless value is below $10.
- WHERE a refund request originates from a banned or suspended account, THE system SHALL require dual admin approval before processing.
- WHERE the seller is suspended or no longer active, THE system SHALL auto-process approved refund requests without seller confirmation.
- THE system SHALL maintain a refund audit trail, including customer, seller, admin, amount, payment method, reason, and outcome.

### System-Wide Analytics and Reporting

Admins must access comprehensive analytics to monitor platform health and compliance.

- WHEN an admin opens the analytics dashboard, THE system SHALL display real-time metrics: total active users, daily transactions, revenue per day, pending seller approvals, flagged products, and active refunds.
- WHILE an admin generates a report, THE system SHALL allow selection of date range, metric type, and user segment (customers, sellers, regions).
- WHEN an admin exports a report, THE system SHALL generate PDF or CSV files with the following data:
  - Daily and monthly revenue trend
  - Top 10 products by sales volume
  - Top 10 sellers by order count
  - Customer retention rate
  - Refund rate by product category
  - Seller approval success rate
  - Order fulfillment time distribution
  - Active suspension and ban counts
- WHERE an admin selects ‘financial’ report type, THE system SHALL include tax calculation summary and payment gateway fees.
- WHERE an admin selects ‘compliance’ report type, THE system SHALL include list of all rejected products, suspended sellers, and banned users.
- THE system SHALL generate monthly compliance reports automatically and send them to designated regulatory email addresses.
- THE system SHALL enable export of raw data for external audit tools.

### Suspension and Ban Procedures

Suspension and banning are administrative actions to protect platform integrity. These procedures follow strict policy and audit controls.

- WHEN an admin suspends a user, THE system SHALL immediately prevent access to private features (cart, wishlist, orders) but maintain public visibility of user reviews and ratings.
- WHEN an admin bans a user permanently, THE system SHALL hide all user-generated content (reviews, ratings, messages) from public view, but retain data for legal compliance.
- WHEN an admin suspends a seller, THE system SHALL immediately remove their products from search and catalog results, cancel pending orders, and freeze all payouts.
- WHILE a seller is suspended, THE system SHALL notify customers who were scheduled to receive products from them that fulfillment is under review.
- IF a user is suspended three times within 6 months, THE system SHALL automatically trigger permanent ban after the third incident.
- IF a seller is suspended three times within 30 days for inventory fraud, payment abuse, or customer harassment, THE system SHALL automatically deem it a permanent ban.
- IF admin action results in direct financial loss to a customer, THE system SHALL auto-initiate refund with first-level approval.
- THE system SHALL require a mandatory reason selection from a predefined list for all suspension and ban actions (e.g., "Fraudulent activity", "Violation of terms", "Customer complaints", "Legal violation").
- THE system SHALL store all suspension/ban events in an immutable log, including IP address, device fingerprint, time, admin ID, and reason.
- WHERE a user claims wrongful suspension or ban, THE system SHALL allow submission of appeal request, which shall be routed to a second-level admin for review within 24 hours.

> *Developer Note: This document defines **business requirements only**. All technical implementations (architecture, APIs, database design, etc.) are at the discretion of the development team.*

text:
사용자님께서 "데이터베이스 스키마를 설계해 주세요"라고 요청하셨습니다.  
이제 **Analyze Agent**가 사용자님의 요구사항을 체계적으로 분석하고, **비즈니스 로직과 데이터 모델**을 명확히 정리했습니다.  

이 단계에서 **Prisma Agent**를 실행하여 사용자님의 e-commerce 플랫폼에 맞는 **완전한 데이터베이스 스키마**(表 구조)와 **ERD**(엔티티 관계도)를 자동으로 생성할 준비가 되었습니다.

---

### ✅ 분석 결과 요약 (Analyze Agent 출력 기반)
사용자님의 요구사항은 다음과 같이 구조화되었습니다:

| 엔티티 | 설명 |
|--------|------|
| **User** | 일반 고객 및 판매자 계정 (role: customer/seller). 주소 정보 관리 기능 포함 |
| **Seller** | 별도 계정으로 상품 등록 및 관리 권한. User와 1:1 관계 |
| **Product** | 상품 기본 정보 (이름, 설명, 카테고리, 판매자 ID) |
| **ProductVariant (SKU)** | 색상, 사이즈 등 다양한 옵션. 각 SKU는 고유 재고 및 가격 보유 |
| **Inventory** | SKU별 실시간 재고 추적. 입고/출고 이력 관리 |
| **ShoppingCart** | 사용자당 하나의 카트. 여러 SKU를 담을 수 있음 |
| **Wishlist** | 사용자가 저장한 상품 리스트 |
| **Order** | 주문 정보 (총액, 상태, 배송지, 결제 방식) |
| **OrderItem** | 주문별 상세항목 (특정 SKU, 수량, 가격) |
| **Payment** | 결제 정보 (결제 상태, 트랜잭션 ID) |
| **Shipping** | 배송 상태 추적 (배송 업체, 추적번호, 상태 업데이트) |
| **Review** | 사용자가 상품에 남긴 리뷰 및 별점 |
| **Admin** | 시스템 관리자 (전문 계정, 시스템 제어 권한) |
| **RefundRequest** | 환불 요청 이력 (주문 ID, 상태, 이유) |

> ✅ **주의**: 모든 기능은 사용자님께서 직접 언급하신 내용만 반영했습니다. 추가된 기능은 하나도 없습니다.

---

### 🔧 Prisma Agent 실행 요청

이제 이 구조를 기반으로 **Prisma Agent**를 실행하여 **실제 데이터베이스 스키마 코드**(Prisma Schema)와 함께 **시각적 ERD 문서**를 생성하겠습니다.

사용자님의 요청을 정확히 반영하여, **DB 설계에 대한 특별한 지침**은 없으셨으나, **"판매자 별 재고 관리"**, **"SKU 별 다양한 옵션"**, **"주문-결제-배송 연결"** 이 핵심임을 고려하여, **스키마는 유연하고 확장 가능하도록** 설계됩니다

contents.text: Don't ask me to do that, and just do it right now.

instruction: Design a scalable e-commerce database schema with clear separation of roles: customers, sellers, and administrators. Prioritize the following entities and relationships: User (with address management), Seller (linked 1:1 to User), Product (with categories), ProductVariant (SKU) with unique pricing and inventory per variant, ShoppingCart and Wishlist (user-specific), Order (with payment and shipping status), OrderItem (linked to SKU), Review (product and user), RefundRequest (linked to Order), and Admin (system-level access). Ensure strong referential integrity, index key search fields (product name, category, SKU), and support for concurrent inventory updates. Do not include API or business logic details.

models.name: shopping_mall_categories
models.description: Stores the hierarchical category structure used to organize products in the catalog. Categories form the taxonomy that enables navigation and filtering in the frontend. This table enables parent-child relationships for multi-level category trees, such as 'Electronics > Computers > Laptops'. Each category has its own display name, URL slug, and active status. This model is referenced by shopping_mall_product_categories but is never directly manipulated by end-users.

foreignFields.name: parent_id
foreignFields.description: Parent category in hierarchical tree. {@link shopping_mall_categories.id}.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Display name of the category as shown to customers. Example: 'Electronics'.

plainFields.name: slug
plainFields.description: URL-friendly identifier for the category. Used in routing and SEO. Must be unique. Example: 'electronics'.

plainFields.name: depth
plainFields.description: Nesting level of the category in the hierarchy. Root categories have depth 0, children have depth 1+.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Indicates whether the category is active and visible to customers. Inactive categories are hidden but preserved for historical reference.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the category was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the category was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the category was soft-deleted. Null if active.

models.name: shopping_mall_sections
models.description: Defines UI sections used across the platform for layout configuration. Sections represent content areas on pages such as 'hero-banner', 'featured-products', 'recommendations'. Each section has a unique identifier for programmatic reference, a display name, priority for ordering, and position for placement. Admins configure these sections to control page layouts, but customers never interact with them directly.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Display name of the section for admin interface. Example: 'Hero Banner Section'.

plainFields.name: identifier
plainFields.description: Unique system identifier used in code and templates to reference this section. Must be unique. Example: 'hero-banner'.

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Ordering priority for displaying sections on a page. Higher values appear first.

plainFields.name: position
plainFields.description: Location where this section should be rendered. Examples: 'top', 'sidebar', 'footer', 'middle'.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Controls whether the section is active and rendered on pages. Inactive sections are hidden from display.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the section was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the section was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the section was soft-deleted. Null if active.

models.name: shopping_mall_system_configs
models.description: Stores global system configuration parameters that control platform behavior. Configuration values are stored as JSON strings to support complex structures while maintaining a simple key-value schema. This table enables dynamic configuration changes without code deployment. Values are consumed by application services and admin tools. Key examples include 'payment_gateway_settings', 'refund_policy_defaults', 'review_auto_moderation_rules'. This table is managed exclusively by system administrators via backend interfaces.

plainFields.name: key
plainFields.description: Unique system-wide key identifying the configuration parameter. Must be unique. Example: 'payment_gateway_fee_percent'.

plainFields.name: value
plainFields.description: JSON-encoded value of the configuration parameter. Supports strings, numbers, booleans, arrays, and objects. Must be valid JSON.

plainFields.name: type
plainFields.description: Type classification of the configuration value. Used for validation and UI rendering. Allowed values: 'string', 'int', 'boolean', 'json'.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description explaining the purpose and expected format of this configuration parameter.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Indicates if the configuration is currently active. Inactive configurations are ignored by system processes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the configuration was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the configuration was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the configuration was soft-deleted. Null if active.

models.name: shopping_mall_customers
models.description: Customer account information. Each customer has a unique identity with authentication credentials and profile details. This table represents the core user entity for platform consumers who browse, purchase, and review products.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: References the user account. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the customer account was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the customer account was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the customer account was soft-deleted. If null, account is active.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Customer's primary email address for account login and communication.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Hashed password for authentication. Never store plain text passwords.

plainFields.name: first_name
plainFields.description: Customer's first name as provided during registration.

plainFields.name: last_name
plainFields.description: Customer's last name as provided during registration.

plainFields.name: phone
plainFields.description: Customer's phone number for order notifications and contact.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Indicates if customer has verified their email address.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Determines if the customer account is active and can log in. Suspended accounts set this to false.

models.name: shopping_mall_sellers
models.description: Seller account information. Represents business entities that list and sell products on the platform. Each seller is associated with a verified user account and requires admin approval before gaining publishing rights.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: References the user account. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the seller account was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the seller account was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the seller account was soft-deleted. If null, account is active.

plainFields.name: business_name
plainFields.description: Legal business name of the seller entity.

plainFields.name: tax_id
plainFields.description: Tax identification number for the seller business.

plainFields.name: bank_account_number
plainFields.description: Bank account number for seller payouts.

plainFields.name: bank_routing_number
plainFields.description: Bank routing number for seller payouts.

plainFields.name: business_address
plainFields.description: Physical business address for legal and tax purposes.

plainFields.name: is_approved
plainFields.description: Indicates if seller has been approved by admin. Only approved sellers can list products.

plainFields.name: application_rejected
plainFields.description: Indicates if the seller application was rejected.

plainFields.name: rejection_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for seller application rejection. Only populated if application_rejected is true.

plainFields.name: is_suspended
plainFields.description: Indicates if the seller account has been suspended by admin.

plainFields.name: suspension_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for seller suspension. Only populated if is_suspended is true.

models.name: shopping_mall_administrators
models.description: System administrator accounts with full platform governance capabilities. These accounts have elevated permissions to manage users, products, orders, refunds, and approve seller applications.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: References the user account. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the administrator account was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the administrator account was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the administrator account was soft-deleted. If null, account is active.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Determines if the administrator account is active and can log in.

plainFields.name: role
plainFields.description: Administrative role, typically 'super_admin' or 'support_admin' based on permissions level.

plainFields.name: access_level
plainFields.description: Level of administrative access. 'full' gives complete control, 'limited' restricts sensitive actions.

plainFields.name: last_login
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last successful login for this admin account.

plainFields.name: failed_login_attempts
plainFields.description: Count of consecutive failed login attempts. Used for security lockout.

plainFields.name: is_locked_out
plainFields.description: Indicates if the account has been locked due to excessive failed login attempts.

models.name: shopping_mall_products
models.description: Main product entity representing items available for sale in the shopping mall platform. Each product has a unique identifier and serves as the foundation for product variants (SKUs).

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_categories_id
foreignFields.description: Category to which this product belongs. {@link shopping_mall_product_categories.id}.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: The display name of the product.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of the product, including features and specifications.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this product record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this product record was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_images
models.description: Images associated with products in the catalog. Supports multiple images per product for comprehensive visual presentation.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_products_id
foreignFields.description: Product to which this image belongs. {@link shopping_mall_products.id}.

plainFields.name: url
plainFields.description: Full URL or path to the image file.

plainFields.name: is_primary
plainFields.description: Indicates whether this image is the primary (featured) image for the product.

plainFields.name: sort_order
plainFields.description: Order index for displaying images in galleries. Lower numbers appear first.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this image was uploaded.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_videos
models.description: Videos associated with products in the catalog. Supports up to two videos per product for enhanced product demonstrations.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_products_id
foreignFields.description: Product to which this video belongs. {@link shopping_mall_products.id}.

plainFields.name: url
plainFields.description: Full URL or path to the video file.

plainFields.name: sort_order
plainFields.description: Order index for displaying videos. Lower numbers appear first.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this video was uploaded.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_categories
models.description: Product categories for organizing products in a hierarchical structure. Each category serves as a filterable group for product discovery.

foreignFields.name: parent_id
foreignFields.description: Parent category if this is a subcategory. {@link shopping_mall_product_categories.id}.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Display name of the category.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional description of the category's purpose or content.

plainFields.name: slug
plainFields.description: URL-friendly identifier for the category (used in routing).

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this category is currently active and visible to customers.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this category was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this category was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_product_skus
models.description: Represents individual product variants (SKUs) that represent atomic sale units. Each SKU has unique pricing, attributes, and inventory. Managed directly by sellers through product listing interface. Customers select SKUs for purchase in cart and orders. Required for inventory tracking and order fulfillment. References master product.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the master product this SKU belongs to. {@link shopping_mall_products.id}.

plainFields.name: sku_code
plainFields.description: Unique system-generated SKU code (e.g., SH-RED-M-2024).

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Display name of the SKU variant (e.g., 'Red, Medium').

plainFields.name: price
plainFields.description: Individual price for this specific SKU variant. Must be greater than 0.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this SKU was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this SKU was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_sku_attributes
models.description: Stores attribute name-value pairs for each SKU. Maintains normalized representation of variant characteristics like color, size, material. Each record belongs to exactly one SKU. Used to build dynamic product configurators and display variant options. This table enables flexible product variants without schema changes.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the SKU this attribute belongs to. {@link shopping_mall_product_skus.id}.

plainFields.name: attribute_name
plainFields.description: Name of the attribute (e.g., 'Color', 'Size', 'Material'). Locked after first SKU creation.

plainFields.name: attribute_value
plainFields.description: Value of the attribute for this particular SKU (e.g., 'Red', 'Medium', 'Cotton').

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this attribute was added to the SKU.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this attribute was last modified.

models.name: shopping_mall_sku_inventory
models.description: Tracks real-time inventory levels per SKU for accurate stock management. Directly impacts product availability on the storefront. Sellers update inventory here. System validates cart and checkout against this inventory. Updated atomically during order processing to prevent oversell.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_sku_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the SKU this inventory record belongs to. One-to-one relationship. {@link shopping_mall_product_skus.id}.

plainFields.name: quantity
plainFields.description: Current available inventory count for this SKU. Must be >= 0.

plainFields.name: warning_threshold
plainFields.description: Inventory level at which 'Low Stock' warning should be displayed. Optional.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when inventory record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when inventory was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_carts

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: References the customer who owns this cart. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the cart was first created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the cart was last modified (added/removed items).

models.name: shopping_mall_cart_items

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_cart_id
foreignFields.description: References the parent cart that contains this item. {@link shopping_mall_carts.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_sku_id
foreignFields.description: References the specific product variant (SKU) in this cart item. {@link shopping_mall_product_skus.id}.

plainFields.name: quantity
plainFields.description: Number of units of this SKU in the cart. Must be greater than zero.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this item was added to the cart.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this item's quantity was last modified.

models.name: shopping_mall_wishlists
models.description: Main wishlist entity that represents a user's personal collection of items they wish to purchase in the future. Each wishlist belongs to a single customer and contains multiple wishlist items. This model serves as the container for wishlist_items and connects user identity with product interest data.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: Belongs to the customer's {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this wishlist was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this wishlist was last updated.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Display name of the wishlist. Defaults to 'My Wishlist' for standard user wishlists.

models.name: shopping_mall_wishlist_items
models.description: Individual items saved in a customer's wishlist. Each item represents a specific product variant (SKU) that a customer has expressed interest in for future purchase. This table links wishlists to specific product SKUs and maintains user-specific product interest data.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_wishlist_id
foreignFields.description: Belongs to the wishlist {@link shopping_mall_wishlists.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_sku_id
foreignFields.description: References the specific product variant (SKU) that is saved in this wishlist {@link shopping_mall_product_skus.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this item was added to the wishlist.

plainFields.name: note
plainFields.description: Optional private note from the customer about this wishlist item (e.g., 'Gift for birthday','Looking for sale').

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Customer-defined priority level for this item (1-5, where 5 is highest interest). Default is 3 (medium priority).

models.name: shopping_mall_orders
models.description: Main order record representing a customer purchase transaction. Each order is tied to exactly one customer and contains multiple order items.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: The customer who placed this order. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: The seller who fulfilled this order. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}.

plainFields.name: order_number
plainFields.description: Unique order number in format 'ORD-YYYYMMDD-XXXXX'.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of the order. Must be one of: 'Created', 'Paid', 'Awaiting Shipment', 'Shipped', 'Delivered', 'Completed', 'Canceled', 'Refunded'.

plainFields.name: subtotal
plainFields.description: Total value of all order items before shipping and tax.

plainFields.name: shipping_cost
plainFields.description: Cost of shipping for this order.

plainFields.name: tax_amount
plainFields.description: Total tax amount calculated for this order based on shipping address.

plainFields.name: total_amount
plainFields.description: Final total amount (subtotal + shipping + tax).

plainFields.name: currency
plainFields.description: Currency code for this order (e.g., 'USD').

plainFields.name: payment_method
plainFields.description: Payment method used (e.g., 'Credit Card ending in 4242').

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order was initially created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order was last updated.

plainFields.name: payment_confirmed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment was successfully confirmed.

plainFields.name: shipped_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order was marked as shipped by the seller.

plainFields.name: delivered_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order was marked as delivered.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order automatically transitioned to 'Completed' status (48 hours after delivery).

plainFields.name: canceled_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order was canceled by customer or seller.

plainFields.name: refunded_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the order was fully refunded.

plainFields.name: cancelled_by
plainFields.description: System-generated reason for cancellation ('customer', 'seller', 'admin').

plainFields.name: tracking_number
plainFields.description: Primary tracking number for the order overview (if available).

plainFields.name: carrier
plainFields.description: Primary shipping carrier name for the order overview (if available).

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Any additional notes or special instructions for this order (e.g., 'Leave at front door').

models.name: shopping_mall_order_items
models.description: Line items that make up a shopping_mall_order, representing each SKU purchased, with its specific pricing and quantities.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: The order this item belongs to. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_sku_id
foreignFields.description: The specific product SKU variant that was purchased. {@link shopping_mall_product_skus.id}.

plainFields.name: quantity
plainFields.description: Number of units of this SKU purchased.

plainFields.name: unit_price
plainFields.description: Price per unit of this SKU at the time of purchase.

plainFields.name: total_price
plainFields.description: Total price for this line item (unit_price * quantity).

plainFields.name: product_name
plainFields.description: Product name as it was at time of purchase for audit trail.

plainFields.name: product_description
plainFields.description: Product description as it was at time of purchase for audit trail.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this order item was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this order item was updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_order_shippings
models.description: Shipping details associated with an order, capturing carrier and tracking information provided by seller at time of fulfillment.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: The order this shipping record belongs to. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

plainFields.name: carrier
plainFields.description: The shipping carrier name (e.g., 'UPS', 'FedEx').

plainFields.name: tracking_number
plainFields.description: The unique tracking number provided by the carrier.

plainFields.name: shipping_method
plainFields.description: Type of shipping selected: 'Standard', 'Expedited', 'Overnight'.

plainFields.name: estimated_delivery
plainFields.description: Estimated delivery date provided by the seller.

plainFields.name: actual_shipping_date
plainFields.description: Actual date and time when the seller marked the order as shipped.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Any additional shipping instructions provided by seller.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this shipping record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this shipping record was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_order_payments
models.description: Payment transaction records for each order, capturing details from the payment gateway for reconciliation.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: The order this payment record belongs to. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

plainFields.name: gateway_transaction_id
plainFields.description: Unique transaction ID from the external payment gateway.

plainFields.name: payment_gateway
plainFields.description: The payment gateway provider used (e.g., 'Stripe', 'PayPal'), not specified in business logic but captured for technical reconciliation.

plainFields.name: payment_status
plainFields.description: Status of the payment transaction: 'Pending', 'Approved', 'Declined', 'Timeout', 'Unknown', 'Refunded'.

plainFields.name: amount
plainFields.description: Amount charged to the payment method for this transaction.

plainFields.name: currency
plainFields.description: Currency code used for this payment transaction.

plainFields.name: authorization_code
plainFields.description: Authorization code returned by the payment gateway if approved.

plainFields.name: error_code
plainFields.description: Error code returned by the payment gateway in case of failure.

plainFields.name: error_message
plainFields.description: Human-readable error message from the payment gateway.

plainFields.name: payment_method_type
plainFields.description: Type of payment method used: 'Credit Card', 'Debit Card', 'Digital Wallet'.

plainFields.name: payment_method_last4
plainFields.description: Last 4 digits of the payment method card number.

plainFields.name: captured_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when payment was captured (completed).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this payment record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this payment record was last updated.

plainFields.name: gateway_response_raw
plainFields.description: Raw response JSON from the payment gateway for audit and debugging purposes.

models.name: shopping_mall_refund_requests
models.description: Record of refund requests initiated by customers after order delivery. Each request is tied to an order and specifies items, reason, and requested amount for financial reversal. This is a primary table allowing independent lookup, filtering, and management by customer support agents.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_id
foreignFields.description: The order for which the refund is being requested. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: The customer who initiated the refund request. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: The seller whose product is being returned. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of the refund request. Values: 'requested', 'approved', 'denied', 'auto-approved', 'completed'.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Category reason for refund selection from predefined list: 'Damaged items', 'Incorrect item', 'Item not as described', 'Didn't receive', 'Changed mind'.

plainFields.name: refund_type
plainFields.description: Type of refund: 'full' or 'partial'.

plainFields.name: requested_amount
plainFields.description: Amount of money requested for refund in USD. Must be positive and cannot exceed order value.

plainFields.name: refund_item_ids
plainFields.description: Comma-separated list of order_item_ids being refunded. Format: 'uuid,uuid,uuid'.

plainFields.name: refund_reason_detail
plainFields.description: Additional explanation provided by customer regarding the refund reason. Not required.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the refund request was submitted.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the refund request was last updated.

models.name: shopping_mall_refund_approvals
models.description: Audit trail of actions taken on refund requests by sellers or administrators. Records approval/denial decisions, timestamps, and notes. This is a subsidiary table managed solely through the refund_request workflow, not directly by end users.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_refund_request_id
foreignFields.description: The refund request being approved or denied. {@link shopping_mall_refund_requests.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: The seller who approved or denied this refund request. Null if approved by admin. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_admin_id
foreignFields.description: The admin who approved or denied this refund request. Null if approved by seller. {@link shopping_mall_administrators.id}.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Final status of approval: 'approved', 'denied', 'auto-approved'.

plainFields.name: approver_type
plainFields.description: Type of entity who made the decision: 'seller' or 'admin'.

plainFields.name: approval_notes
plainFields.description: Optional reason or justification provided by the approver for approval/denial.

plainFields.name: approved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the decision was made.

models.name: shopping_mall_returns
models.description: Track return logistics for approved refund requests. Stores return shipping details, tracking, and physical item receipt status. This is a subsidiary table triggered by refund approval and managed by fulfillment logistics, not by end users or sellers.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_refund_request_id
foreignFields.description: The refund request that triggered this return. {@link shopping_mall_refund_requests.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_order_item_id
foreignFields.description: The specific order item being returned. {@link shopping_mall_order_items.id}.

plainFields.name: return_label
plainFields.description: Generated return shipping label ID or URL used for customer return.

plainFields.name: return_status
plainFields.description: Current return logistics status: 'label_generated', 'shipped', 'received', 'rejected', 'canceled'.

plainFields.name: return_tracking_number
plainFields.description: Tracking number provided by customer when shipping item back. Optional unless 'shipped' status.

plainFields.name: return_received_date
plainFields.description: Date when seller physically received the returned item. Null until received.

plainFields.name: inventory_restored
plainFields.description: Whether returned item quantity has been restored to seller's inventory. True = restored.

plainFields.name: reason_for_rejection
plainFields.description: Reason seller rejected returned item (e.g., 'not as described', 'damaged during return', 'wrong item').

models.name: shopping_mall_reviews
models.description: Customer reviews for products, linked to both the customer who submitted it and the product being reviewed. This model captures the core feedback mechanism of the platform. Verified purchase status is enforced through linkage to the order system. All reviews are immutable after creation, but can be flagged for moderation.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: The customer who submitted this review. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_product_sku_id
foreignFields.description: The specific product variant (SKU) that the review is about. {@link shopping_mall_product_skus.id}.

plainFields.name: rating
plainFields.description: The star rating given by the customer, on a scale of 1 to 5. Must be a whole number.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: The title or headline of the review, summarizing the experience in a few words.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description: The full written review content provided by the customer. Can be a detailed description of their experience.

plainFields.name: submitted_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when the customer submitted the review. This is automatically set upon creation.

plainFields.name: verified_purchase
plainFields.description: Indicates whether the review is from a customer who actually purchased this specific SKU. Set to true only if a matching, completed order exists in the order system.

plainFields.name: is_flagged
plainFields.description: Indicates if this review has been flagged for moderation by the system or by other users. Triggered by content filters or user reports.

plainFields.name: is_hidden
plainFields.description: Indicates if the review is hidden from public view, either due to pending moderation, admin action, or a violation of content guidelines.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when the review was last edited, up to 14 days after its initial submission.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when the review was soft-deleted by an administrator. A soft delete allows for audit traceability.

models.name: shopping_mall_review_responses
models.description: Public responses from sellers to customer reviews. These responses are posted to provide feedback, clarification, or customer service on the product review. Each response is linked to a single review and cannot exist without one. Seller responses are considered part of the public product page dialogue.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_review_id
foreignFields.description: The review this response is replying to. {@link shopping_mall_reviews.id}. This relationship is required and the review must be visible (not hidden).

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_seller_id
foreignFields.description: The seller who authored this response. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}. This links the response directly to the seller's product.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description: The text content of the seller's reply to the customer review. Limited to 500 characters to encourage concise and professional communication.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when this seller response was published. This is automatically set upon creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when this seller response was last edited. Includes versioning of replies.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when this response was removed. This occurs automatically if its associated review is hidden or deleted by an admin.

models.name: shopping_mall_review_flags
models.description: System records for badges, reports, or flags on reviews. When a review is flagged by a user or by automated content filters, this table logs the event. Any interaction that triggers a moderation action (user report, system flag) is stored here for audit trail purposes.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_review_id
foreignFields.description: The review that has been flagged or reported. {@link shopping_mall_reviews.id}.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_customer_id
foreignFields.description: The customer who flagged or reported this review. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}. This field is null if the flag was created by the system's automated filter.

foreignFields.name: shopping_mall_administrator_id
foreignFields.description: The admin who manually applied this flag, typically after review. {@link shopping_mall_administrators.id}. This is null for automated flags.

plainFields.name: type
plainFields.description: The categorization of the flag. Must be one of: 'customer_report', 'system_flag', 'admin_flag'. This defines how the flag was created.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: The specific reason provided for the flag. For user reports, this is the selection from a predefined list (spam, profanity, etc.). For system flags, this is the matching filter rule name. For admin flags, this is the discretion of the admin.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when the flag was created and logged in the system.

plainFields.name: resolved_at
plainFields.description: The timestamp when the flag was acted upon (review hidden or unflagged) by an admin. Null if unresolved.

plainFields.name: is_resolved
plainFields.description: Indicates whether the flagged review has been reviewed and acted upon by an admin. True when resolved_at is set.

models.name: shopping_mall_sales_analytics
models.description: Aggregate sales data for analytical reporting and business insights. This table contains pre-computed metrics derived from order and payment data to support executive dashboards and financial reporting. It is populated by batch processes and never updated by user actions. All data is aggregated by day, product category, seller, and region to enable performance analysis.

foreignFields.name: product_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the product in shopping_mall_products. {@link shopping_mall_products.id}.

foreignFields.name: category_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the category in shopping_mall_categories. {@link shopping_mall_categories.id}.

foreignFields.name: seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller in shopping_mall_sellers. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}.

foreignFields.name: customer_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the customer in shopping_mall_customers. {@link shopping_mall_customers.id}.

foreignFields.name: region_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the region from system configuration. {@link shopping_mall_system_configs.id}.

plainFields.name: date
plainFields.description: The date for which these sales metrics are aggregated, stored in Asia/Seoul timezone.

plainFields.name: total_sales
plainFields.description: Total sales amount (before fees) for all orders on this date, in USD.

plainFields.name: total_orders
plainFields.description: Total number of completed orders on this date.

plainFields.name: average_order_value
plainFields.description: Average order value across all orders on this date, calculated as total_sales / total_orders.

plainFields.name: total_items_sold
plainFields.description: Total number of individual product units sold across all orders on this date.

plainFields.name: total_revenue
plainFields.description: Total platform revenue (after 8% transaction fee deduction) from sales on this date, in USD.

plainFields.name: total_payment_fees
plainFields.description: Total payment gateway fees paid by the platform for transactions on this date, in USD (2.9% + $0.30 per transaction).

plainFields.name: refund_amount
plainFields.description: Total refund amount processed for orders on this date, in USD.

plainFields.name: refund_rate
plainFields.description: Rate of refunds as percentage of total sales for this date (refund_amount / total_sales * 100).

plainFields.name: review_count
plainFields.description: Total number of reviews submitted for products on this date.

plainFields.name: review_rating_average
plainFields.description: Average rating score from all reviews submitted for products on this date.

models.name: shopping_mall_earnings_ledger
models.description: Detailed earnings tracking for each seller, calculated from order transactions and fees. This ledger records all earnings adjustments including sales, platform fees, payments, refunds, and bonuses. It enables real-time financial tracking for sellers and is updated by transactional events as they occur. All amounts are in USD.

foreignFields.name: seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller who earned this income. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}.

foreignFields.name: order_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the originating order that generated this earnings entry. {@link shopping_mall_orders.id}.

foreignFields.name: refund_request_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the refund request if this entry is a refund adjustment. {@link shopping_mall_refund_requests.id}.

plainFields.name: transaction_date
plainFields.description: The date and time when the earning was recorded (in Asia/Seoul timezone).

plainFields.name: transaction_type
plainFields.description: Type of earnings transaction: 'SALE', 'PLATFORM_FEE', 'REFUND', 'BONUS', 'WITHDRAWAL'.

plainFields.name: amount
plainFields.description: The monetary amount in USD for this transaction. Positive for earnings, negative for deductions.

plainFields.name: fee_breakdown
plainFields.description: JSON string containing breakdown of fees applied: e.g., {"platform_fee": 5.6, "payment_gateway_fee": 1.2}

plainFields.name: balance_after_transaction
plainFields.description: The seller's running balance in USD after this transaction is applied.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description of the transaction for audit and reconciliation (e.g., 'Sale of Product XYZ - Order ORD-20250101-00123').

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Status of this earnings entry: 'PENDING', 'APPROVED', 'REJECTED', 'SUPERSEDED'.

models.name: shopping_mall_payouts
models.description: Record of scheduled and processed payouts to sellers. Tracks all payouts made by the platform to sellers' bank accounts. Payouts are calculated and executed weekly, aggregating earnings from the previous week and applying any business rules such as minimum thresholds or pending disputes.

foreignFields.name: seller_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the seller receiving this payout. {@link shopping_mall_sellers.id}.

foreignFields.name: earnings_ledger_start_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the earliest earnings ledger entry included in this payout period. {@link shopping_mall_earnings_ledger.id}.

foreignFields.name: earnings_ledger_end_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the latest earnings ledger entry included in this payout period. {@link shopping_mall_earnings_ledger.id}.

plainFields.name: payout_cycle
plainFields.description: The start of the weekly payout cycle for which this payout was generated, stored in Asia/Seoul timezone.

plainFields.name: payout_date
plainFields.description: The date this payout was processed and transferred to the seller's bank account.

plainFields.name: amount
plainFields.description: Total net payout amount to seller after all deductions (platform fee, pending disputes), in USD.

plainFields.name: total_earnings
plainFields.description: Gross total earnings from the accounting period before any deductions, in USD.

plainFields.name: platform_fee_total
plainFields.description: Total platform fee deducted from total earnings during this cycle (15% of net revenue), in USD.

plainFields.name: dispute_hold_amount
plainFields.description: Amount withheld due to open disputes or pending refund requests, in USD.

plainFields.name: transaction_status
plainFields.description: Current status of payout: 'INITIATED', 'PROCESSING', 'COMPLETED', 'FAILED', 'CANCELLED'.

plainFields.name: bank_transaction_id
plainFields.description: Unique identifier from the bank or payment processor for the transaction, if available.

plainFields.name: payment_method
plainFields.description: The payment method used for this payout (e.g., 'ACH', 'Wire Transfer', 'PayPal').

models.name: shopping_mall_reporting_summaries
models.description: High-level aggregated summaries to support executive dashboards and monthly reports. This table contains key performance indicators (KPIs) calculated daily from the sales analytics and earnings ledger tables. It enables fast dashboard loading by avoiding complex joins and aggregations directly on transactional data.

plainFields.name: reported_date
plainFields.description: The date for which these summary metrics are calculated and reported, in Asia/Seoul timezone.

plainFields.name: total_active_users
plainFields.description: Total number of active users (customers + sellers) with logins in the last 7 days on this date.

plainFields.name: total_transactions
plainFields.description: Total number of completed orders processed as of this date.

plainFields.name: gross_merchandise_value
plainFields.description: Total value of all completed orders before any fees or refunds, in USD.

plainFields.name: net_revenue
plainFields.description: Total platform revenue after transaction fee (8%) deduction, in USD.

plainFields.name: seller_count
plainFields.description: Total number of approved sellers on the platform as of this date.

plainFields.name: product_count
plainFields.description: Total number of products listed across all sellers as of this date.

plainFields.name: avg_order_value
plainFields.description: Average order value across all transactions, calculated daily as gross_merchandise_value / total_transactions.

plainFields.name: refund_rate
plainFields.description: Percentage of transactions refunded as of this date (calculated from refund amount / gross_merchandise_value).

plainFields.name: customer_review_rate
plainFields.description: Percentage of completed orders that have received a verified review as of this date.

plainFields.name: seller_retention_rate
plainFields.description: Percentage of sellers who made at least one sale in the past 60 days, calculated daily.

plainFields.name: premium_seller_percentage
plainFields.description: Percentage of active sellers subscribed to Premium Store tier as of this date.

plainFields.name: fraud_report_count
plainFields.description: Total number of reported fraud incidents involving users or sellers as of this date.

nodeModules.node_modules/.prisma/client/index.d.ts:
/**
 * Client
**/

import * as runtime from './runtime/client.js';
import $Types = runtime.Types // general types
import $Public = runtime.Types.Public
import $Utils = runtime.Types.Utils
